TextView.android:text: Slow Running Computer
While using your computer, you might recognize that it may take up for a while to load until your computer is being unstable to use.
This often indicates that your computer hardware and software that needs to repair or upgrade.
\nFirst Solution:
Free up your storage space
Sometimes low on storage space might cause instability to your computer.
Your computer will run slowly due to insufficient space to provide functionality to your other applications or software.
Delete Unnessesary files or uninstall some of unused applications.
We will be using windows disk cleanup for removing temporary files.
How to delete temporary files using Windows Disk Cleanup
1. Go to file explorer then right click "Local Disk (C:)".
2. After clicking "Local Disk (C:)", click on Properties and Locate the Button "Disk Cleanup" then click it
3. After Clicking the "Disk Cleanup" and wait the program to load up.
4. When the program has finished loading up you may check all the boxes of temporary files to delete then press the "OK" button.
5. A window may pop up that says " Are you sure you want to permanently delete these files?", Press the button "Delete Files".
6. After you delete the temporary files, you may click on "Clean up system files" and wait the program to finish loading up.
7. when the program finished loading up, you may check all the temporary files and click the "OK" button
8. A window may pop up that says "Are you sure you want to permanently delete these files?", Press the button "Delete Files".
For video tutorial, click the button below
\nSecond Solution:
Update your operating system and system drivers
Outdated drivers causes your computer to crash where it will lead to unexpected shutdowns.
There are many ways to update your drivers but we will using "Windows Update" to check your outdated drivers
Steps to update your drivers using Windows Updates (win10/win11)
1. Go to Settings by pressing the windows icon at the bottom left corner or press the windows key to your keyboard and press the settings icon.
2. After you open the settings, go to update and security and press the check updates.
3. After checking for available updates, press update now. While waiting to install the updates, press the view optional updates.
4. after pressing the View optional updates, you may see available updates for your drivers. Update and install all of them.
5. After updating all of your drivers and operating system updates, Restart your computer to apply your driver updates.
For video tutorial, click the button below
\nThird Solution:
Check for malware/viruses
Blue Screen of death are commonly found if there are any active malwares.
Try scanning your computer using a built in anti-virus software such as Microsoft Defender.
How to detect malwares using Microsoft Defender (win10/win11)
1. Press the window searchbar and type "Windows Security" and press it then press the "Virus & threat protection".
2. After you open "Virus & threat protection", press the button "Quick Scan" to start searching for malware and viruses
3. Wait the program to finish scanning your computer.
For video of advanced detecting malwares, click the button below
\nFourth Solution:
Upgrade your equipment
Upgrading your PC equipment can significantly improve its performance, particularly if your current setup is causing slow operation.
For guide on how to upgrade your PC equipment, click the button below
\nFifth Solution:
Adjust system performance
Adjusting your system visuals may increase perfomance. It disables animation features of windows.
How to Adjust Windows Visuals using Advance System Properties
1. Go to file explorer and right click "This PC" and press "Properties"
2. A window will show up and find "Advance system settings" then press it
3. Another window will show up and in the "Advance" section, click "Settings" button in the Perfomance section.
4. A window will show up and under the visual effects you may uncheck all or some of the windows animation features.

Deleting unnessesary files and adjust system performance increases computers performance
Updating your operating system and system drivers may impact your computers performance too.
But upgrading your computer equipment will noticeably improve the performance level of your computer, ensuring smoother operation and reducing frustrating slowdowns
